intro: Psychotria panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian psychotria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical regions of Panama and Costa Rica. This species typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have a distinctive purple or pink coloration. The plant is also noted for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
